text:
"Oh wow, that intro sure was weird. Oh well, nice track and what a village...a wedding you say? How nic-ZOMG GIANT ROBOTS!"

*thirty minutes in* 
What is going oooon?!!

*Halfway through the game, eyes blood shot*
This is the greatest game...ever...madeeee!
author: mohawkbrando

text:
Looking back, I thought how huge of turn of events transpired in-game to make this one of the greatest rpgs of all time and now that I listened to this I realize they did such a good job to disguise it as another traditional RPG. 

Well played.

author: Spraxis

text: XenoSaga 1 was an absurdely horrible game. 1 Battle Track for a 40hr+ game, half the character cast annoying, bad synchronisation, boring and bad balanced fighting system, and every 3 hours comes some space ship or station TEN TIMES larger than the last one. I'm not kidding here, the characters are amazed every time, and the penultimate dungeon, as big as a small planet, is some sort of key for the last one which is as big as half a star system.

author: Spraxis

text:
@Bolt892
chill the hell out, Im going to assume you havent even considered that DQ and Chrono Trigger are illustrated by the same person. Im also going to assume from your attitude that you dont even think graphics matter at all. when used correctly, graphics add to immersion, if it was like DQ8 level of graphics, you would feel like you are following Chrono and his friends more so than with the 2D sprites of the SNES. though with Square the way it is now, i dont want them trying that...

author: Bolt892

text: @Xelrac7 at this point, square needs to remake FF7 to stay alive, 13 was a bit of a flop, it looked nice, but the story was confusing, they never really explained anything, plus there isnt really any exploring element to the game either. we need to see old games revitalized in my opinion, many of them, if their graphics were improved to at least FF13 standards, it would be an orgasm for the eyes and would still be an epic game. imagine Chrono Trigger with DQ8+ graphics, THAT would be EPIC.

author: cobbil

text: Impossible to compare. Both worked so well with the game they were intended for. Xenogears' music has the advantage of having layers of richness to them, while Chrono Trigger's OST was just perfect for the feel of the game.
author: cobbil

text: I love this song. It sounds like Irish folkdance music.
author: PAVGN

text: This is one of my favorite town themes in all the games I've ever played. "Xenogears" has an amazing soundtrack; I think it's the best thing Yasunori Mitsuda's ever done. The synth sounds are amazing as well - why didn't they give Nobuo Uematsu sounds like this for his "Final Fantasy" soundtracks (particularly FF7)??

text: A masterpiece of a game scarred slightly by too small a budget.  Everyone I've met who doesn't like it has not played past Dazil.  There is no story in RPGdom to compare, though I've played games with better gameplay value.
